page.title: 02WILD LIFE AND ECOLOGY I
page.content: The rural nature of the area leads to an abundance of wild life. {Principal ecological areas are around {the River Avon and the expanses of {woodland on the escarpment. Families of swans exist on the river together with moorhens which have recently made a reappearance following the disappearance of Mink. There has been an increase of Kingfishers nesting on the banks over previous years and some sightings of pairs of Coots. The Rake pond on the Lackham Estate has recently been cleared with additional ponds created in a {conservation area.}The resultant increase in pond life, significantly with the appearance of Mallard Duck points to the success of this venture.
